style. Am glad she never outgrew it as her letters are always entertaining whether newsy or not.

 The robins are all here - so are meadow larks and others I don't know the names of, but whose notes are familiar. seems so good to hear them.
 Daylight savings begins Easter Sunday. would rather not have it, so far as I am concerned, but most city people are in favor of it. Am planning

to make M. pair of trousers from my old black velvet skirt and two blouses of natural color pongee which I bought some time ago. Picture of 
pattern enclosed.

                                                                                                   Glen Ellyn, ILL.
                                                                                                     March 25, 1921.

Dear Mum & Grandmum:

 Customary $5 00 enclosed. Quite rainy lately. Lots of warm weather last Saturday and Sunday. Got up to 78 (degrees). Reached 28 one night this week

so as to keep the green buds in check.

 Speaking of check - Max bought some chess-men and he and I are learning to play. I like it very much more interesting than checkers.
 Took a ride in "Old John" last Sunday. Runs very well in spite of it's winter in the back yard. shall be interested to learn how Fannie's case comes out. Glad

you could go to Tampa and lend your moral support.

 Helen and family brought the crib last Saturday. did not stop except for a few minutes chat. They expect to be located in their new home very soon. Max

gilded crib last night and it looks very well indeed. The airplane bed pad fits it all right so far as width is concerned, so shall use it over the springs - with
oil cloth
Completed

and quilted pad on top. Shall be glad to have the blanket you speak of. It will come in handy for either crib or buggy.

 Hope the matter of the passport has been settled amicably. Finished my comforter several days ago. am much pleased with it and also pleased with cretonne

curtains which are now hung and look very pretty. When we get the rug for the room (which Max expected to select today) it will be quite complete. have not
yet trimmed toilet basket. Was wondering if could use some of the curtaining I have left over, or whether only all white material would be suitable.

 Planted sweet peas on the 18th covered about 3 inches deep. Not up yet. What time should I expect them?
 Mr. and mrs. Bacon were asphyxiated the evening of the 23rd. He is dead - she may recover. They were living in the flat over Patch Bros. Guess it was the

oven in the gas stove. Have not heard complete details. Dr. Schiele had the case.

 Am making black velvet trousers for Malcolm out of old skirt (may have mentioned this 3 or 4 times as has been on my mind for quite a while. They
Completed

M.M. Moore  Art Department                                                                      K.K. Moore  Business Mgr.

                                        M. M. MOORE
                                         Photo Pillow Tops
                                                                                                   Glen Ellyn, ILL.

are well started now and will look quite well. I think the cutting out was the only part that I was anticipating any trouble with.

 Got nice letter from Mrs. Western in answer to my note - congratulating me and hoping it would be a girl. she is planning a birthday celebration for cousin

Martha, who is nearly a year old and invites all of us to come - Sunday, April 3rd. I am accepting for Max and Malcolm but prefer not to make the trip myself,
especially as I am somewhat doubtful of the time to expect Tunsulu. It might just as easily be sooner as later. If a girl, have about decided on Maxine for a name.
If a boy - would rather like Lionel - being sufficiently peculiar and unusual to go with Moore. May decide on something else, however.

 Malcolm has just gone out to join his bosom friend, Buddie. B. is quite annoying, at times. Asks
Completed

an unacceptable number of questions, either very personal or very foolish. also, b rings in much mud, wears coats that have to unhooked and unpinned and then
hooked and pinned either 5 minutes or 5 hours later, according to the length of his stay - and other trivialities which probably are magnified by myself in honor of
my pregnancy.

 I feel real well except for my back and think I shall be able to do the washing and all other work up to the day of confinement.

P.M.  Love in sight.  Must stop.       Much love,  K.
